historical_growth.growth_divergence_warning: EPS growth significantly higher than equity/revenue growth. EPS growth driven by margin expansion and share buybacks. Using conservative equity CAGR for base case projections.

base.rationale: Base case assumes continued strong growth from new store openings (10% unit growth), loyalty program success, and market share gains. Growth decelerates from FY2025 guidance of 14% toward long-term sustainable rate. FCF margin of 5.4% consistent with FY2024 actual (414.8M / 7719.3M). WACC of 9% reflects low debt, equity beta around 1.0-1.2, and current risk-free rates.

bull.rationale: Bull case assumes loyalty program drives significant customer data monetization (from 11% to 80%+ capture rate), self-distribution for meat/seafood replicates produce margin success, aggressive new store growth continues with strong returns, market share gains accelerate as consumers shift from conventional grocers. Operating leverage and margin expansion drive FCF margin to 6.2%. Secular organic food trends remain strong (5%+ industry growth).

bear.rationale: Bear case assumes recession drives customer trade-down to Walmart/Aldi, intense competition from conventional grocers and Whole Foods compresses margins, new store expansion disappoints due to poor site selection or market saturation, loyalty program fails to drive expected data capture, self-distribution transition for meat/seafood creates supply disruptions and cost overruns, California exposure (34% of stores) vulnerable to climate events and economic weakness. FCF margin compresses to 4.5%.

base.calculation: Terminal Value per Share: (10,533.3 + (-269.8)) / 116.4 = 88.19. Adjust for net cash added: 88.19 + 4.57 = 92.76. Entry Price for 15% CAGR: 92.76 / (1.15^5) = 46.14

bull.calculation: Terminal Value per Share: (15,279.6 + (-269.8)) / 116.4 = 128.99. Adjust for net cash: 128.99 + 4.67 = 133.66. Entry Price for 15% CAGR: 133.66 / (1.15^5) = 66.46

bear.calculation: Terminal Value per Share: (5,498.7 + (-269.8)) / 116.4 = 44.93. Adjust for net cash: 44.93 + 4.64 = 49.57. Entry Price for 15% CAGR: 49.57 / (1.15^5) = 24.66

sensitivity.notes: Sensitivity matrix shows intrinsic value per share at different WACC and terminal growth rate combinations using base case assumptions. Current price of $165 suggests market is pricing in very optimistic assumptions (WACC <7% and/or terminal growth >4%) or expecting significantly better FCF margins than historical.

probability_weighted.rationale: Base case weighted at 55% as most likely scenario given management's track record and guidance. Bull case 20% given execution risks on multiple initiatives (loyalty program, self-distribution, new store growth). Bear case 25% given recession risks, competition intensity, and geographic concentration concerns. Weighted IV of $72 suggests significant overvaluation at current price of $165.

valuation_commentary.current_valuation: At $165 per share, SFM trades at significant premium to all DCF scenarios. Market appears to be pricing in perfect execution on all growth initiatives (loyalty program, self-distribution, 10% unit growth) plus margin expansion well beyond historical levels.
valuation_commentary.key_drivers: Valuation highly sensitive to terminal growth rate and FCF margin assumptions. Company's ability to sustain high growth rate (10%+ revenue growth) and expand FCF margins from current 5.4% to 6%+ will be critical. Historical volatility in FCF (ranged from $54M in FY2014 to $415M in FY2024) creates uncertainty.
valuation_commentary.risks_to_valuation: Downside risks include recession-driven trade-down to conventional grocers, competitive margin pressure, new store execution failures, loyalty program disappointment, self-distribution transition issues, and California exposure to climate/economic shocks. FCF margin compression to 4.5% or lower in bear case would significantly impair value.
valuation_commentary.upside_to_valuation: Upside case requires loyalty program to successfully drive customer data capture from 11% to 80%+, self-distribution to replicate produce margin success in meat/seafood, continued market share gains from conventional grocers, and operating leverage from scale. FCF margin expansion to 6-7% could support higher valuations.
valuation_commentary.recommendation: Current price of $165 implies high expectations already embedded. Conservative investors should wait for better entry point. Base case suggests fair value around $79, implying 52% downside risk. Entry price for 15% annual returns would be $46 (72% below current). Only compelling if bull case plays out with high confidence.

fy2025_guidance_implied.notes: Based on management guidance of ~14% sales growth to ~$8.8B and diluted EPS of $5.24-$5.28 (midpoint $5.26). Significant margin expansion expected.

key_assumptions_notes.growth_rate_selection: Selected 9.1% equity 5-year CAGR as base for conservative value investing approach. EPS 5-year CAGR of 21.2% is inflated by margin expansion and buybacks, not sustainable long-term. Revenue 5-year CAGR of 6.5% is too conservative given new store growth trajectory. Equity CAGR balances these factors.
key_assumptions_notes.fcf_margin_assumptions: FY2024 FCF margin of 5.37% used as baseline. Historical FCF has been volatile due to variable capex for new store builds. Normalized FCF margin expected 5-6% range. Bull case 6.2% assumes operating leverage from scale and self-distribution success. Bear case 4.5% assumes margin pressure from competition and execution issues.
key_assumptions_notes.wacc_components: Risk-free rate ~4.5%, equity risk premium ~5.5%, beta ~1.0-1.2 implies cost of equity 10-11%. No debt (paid off in 2024) simplifies WACC to cost of equity. Used 9% WACC for base case reflecting moderate risk profile. Bull 8.5% reflects lower execution risk if initiatives succeed. Bear 10% reflects higher risk from competition and macro headwinds.
key_assumptions_notes.terminal_growth: Base case 3% terminal growth assumes company matures but maintains some growth from secular organic food trends and market share gains. Bull 3.5% assumes continued benefit from health/wellness megatrend. Bear 2.5% assumes competitive pressures and market saturation limit long-term growth. All below historical 5.1% industry CAGR projection for organic food.
key_assumptions_notes.share_count_assumption: Used 116.4M diluted shares from FY2024. Company authorized $600M buyback and has been actively repurchasing (238.5M in FY2024, share count down to 98.6M by Feb 2025 per recent disclosure). Conservative to use higher FY2024 count; lower share count would increase per-share values by 15-20%.
key_assumptions_notes.net_debt_calculation: FY2024: Cash $269.8M, Total Debt $0 (paid off during year). Net Debt = -$269.8M (net cash position). Significantly strengthens balance sheet and provides flexibility for growth investments or returns to shareholders.
